hints.content:
The mass of the shark is $\greenD{792}$ kilograms.  

The mass of the whale is $\purpleD{933}$ kilograms.

We can find how much less the mass of the shark is by subtracting the mass of the shark $(\greenD {792}\text{ kg})$ from the mass of the whale $(\purpleD{933}\text { kg})$.


[[☃ image 1]]

options.alt: Two rectangles sit on top of each other. The top rectangle is labeled 933 kilograms. A curved bracket across the top rectangle is labeled Whale. The bottom rectangle is divided into 2 parts. The longer left part is labeled 792 kilograms. The shorter right part is labeled with a question mark. A curved bracket across the longer left part of the bottom rectangle is labeled Shark. A curved bracket across the shorter right part of the bottom rectangle is labeled Difference. !

hints.content: The shark's mass is $141$ kilograms less than the whale's mass.

question.content:
Waldo's Water World found the mass of its two largest animals, a shark and a whale. 

The whale weighs $933$ kg, and the shark weighs $792$ kg.

**How much less is the mass of the shark than the whale?** 
 
[[☃ input-number 2]] kilograms
